=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Do You Believe? (DVD)
Review Date: 2017/02/23
Store: Mira Sorvino  (Actor),     Sean Astin  (Actor),     Jonathan M. Gunn  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ["A dozen different souls—all moving in different directions, all longing for something more. As their lives unexpectedly intersect, they each are about to discover there is power in the Cross of Christ…even if they don't yet believe it. When a local pastor is shaken to the core by the visible faith of an old street-corner preacher, he is reminded that true belief always requires action. His response ignites a faith-fueled journey that powerfully impacts everyone it touches in ways that only God could orchestrate. More than a movie, it's a question we all must answer in our lifetimes: Do You Believe?", 'Bonus Content:', 'Interviews', 'Interviews', 'Trailers', 'Trailers', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.8

Review Text: I consider myself a movie-buff and I watch all kinds of movies. Love this movie! I love the way the stories intertwine. Wonderful faith-based movies with lots of good acting. Well-made and emotional.
Review Title: Well-made movie wirh good acting.

{'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Harold Cronk'], 'Producers': ['Michael Scott', 'Russell Wolfe', 'David A.R. White', 'Anna Zielinski', 'Elizabeth Travis'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Sorbo', 'Shane Harper', 'David A.R. White'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
Loved it!  I am a movie lover of all types of movies and I loved this.  I have watched lots of Christian movies but this one may be there very best.  I learned a lot and I was surprised as the movie went on.  Some Christian movies don't have big budgets and some have totally expected endings but this one was different.  The acting was great and I was very impressed with Kevin Sorbo's performance.  I can't wait to watch it again to see what I missed the first time.  I would definitely recommend!
Awesome movie!  Can't wait to watch again.
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Neil Burger'], 'Producers': ['Douglas Wick', 'Lucy Fisher', 'Pouya Shahbazian'], 'Starring': ['Shailene Woodley', 'Theo James', 'Ashley Judd'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
I Love It!!  My whole family really enjoyed it and we think we liked it even better than the Hunger Games movies. Also, it was nice to have such a great movie that didn't have anything I wanted to keep my 12 year-old from seeing.
Liked it more than we thought!
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Chris Carter'], 'Producers': ['Chris Carter', 'Marc Rosen', 'Gabe Rotter'], 'Starring': ['Aldis Hodge', 'Andrew Howard', 'Arielle Kebbel']}
I enjoyed the first part of the show but the amount of F Bombs was ridiculous!  Even some of the toughest R rated movies I have seen had less bad language.  I really thought it was a joke at first.  Once we got to the end, I thought it was just plan evil.  Lots of reviews give spoilers about this so I am not giving too much away but the creature at the end just looks evil.  I won't watch again.
Not a great show and the language was ridiculous!

profile:
The user is a dedicated movie enthusiast with a strong preference for Christian films that emphasize quality storytelling and depth. Their recent high rating for a faith-based film highlights their commitment to compelling narratives and strong performances, showcasing their appreciation for well-crafted stories that avoid clichés and predictable endings. Their enjoyment of narrative complexity is evident as they praise films with intertwining plots and emotional resonance.

Inclusivity remains a key value, with a focus on features like audio descriptions and multilingual captions. The user maintains strict boundaries regarding language, indicated by a low rating on content with excessive profanity, reflecting their preference for relatively clean films suitable for younger audiences. Their latest interaction, involving a positive review of a film praised for its excellent acting and heartfelt themes, reinforces their desire for cinematic experiences that are both meaningful and promote personal growth.

The user actively seeks to recommend films that not only entertain but also encourage deeper understanding, aligning with an appreciation for content that fosters reflection. Their consistent focus on impactful storytelling and emotional depth underscores their dedication to high-quality cinema, which profoundly resonates with viewers.
